A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I saw this at the VIP centre in Saskatoon Christmas day and I knew things were going to go off the tracks right from the beginning. The projectionist screwed up something in the projection room and so for the first 8-9 minutes the 3D was not working properly and I missed the rolling text sequence. After a couple theater goers ran out and work up the projection staff the film started. \n\nI will not repeat all the thoughts already played out here but I have to agree with general sentiment here. They assembled all the right characters and then wasted them on a terrible script. I am going to watch the original three movies to get the stench out of my clothes.
